subject: p11879886
History: -year-old female with shortness of breath and history of aortic stenosis. Evaluate for evidence of cardiopulmonary process.
Findings: A left hilar mass is noted, which appears new compared with prior exam of. There is also increased vascular markings in the remaining lung fields as well as a new left-sided pleural effusion. There is mild-to-moderate cardiomegaly which appears to be slightly worsened compared with prior exam. There is no pneumothorax. Sternotomy wires are intact. Multiple surgical clips are noted in the left hemithorax.
Impression: New left hilar mass. A CT is recommended for further assessment. Cardiomegaly associated to increased vascular markings and pleural effusion suggests pulmonary vascular congestion.
